headline: Broadcom's record, Charter's Q2 miss, Newmont's buyback plan
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Broadcom (AVGO) stock extends gains after hitting a record high, with the chipmaker outperforming nearly all of the "Magnificent Seven" stocks this year, second only to Nvidia (NVDA). Charter Communications (CHTR) stock sinks after a second quarter earnings miss and a larger-than-expected loss of residential internet customers. Newmont (NEM) beats second quarter expectations and posts record-high free cash flow, while also announcing a $3 billion share buyback program. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Broadcom's record, Charter's Q2 miss, Newmont's buyback plan
content.description:
Market Domination host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

Broadcom (AVGO) stock extends gains after hitting a record high, with the chipmaker outperforming nearly all of the "Magnificent Seven" stocks this year, second only to Nvidia (NVDA).

Charter Communications (CHTR) stock sinks after a second quarter earnings miss and a larger-than-expected loss of residential internet customers.

Newmont (NEM) beats second quarter expectations and posts record-high free cash flow, while also announcing a $3 billion share buyback program.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
content.summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Broadcom (AVGO) stock extends gains after hitting a record high, with the chipmaker outperforming nearly all of the "Magnificent Seven" stocks this year, second only to Nvidia (NVDA). Charter Communications (CHTR) stock sinks after a second quarter earnings miss and a larger-than-expected loss of residential internet customers. Newmont (NEM) beats second quarter expectations and posts record-high free cash flow, while also announcing a $3 billion share buyback program. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Why Charter (CHTR) Shares Are Getting Obliterated Today

headline: Charter Communications, Tesla, Volkswagen: Trending Tickers
summary: Charter Communications (CHTR) stock is plummeting after reporting a second quarter earnings miss and greater-than-expected customer losses amid competition from mobile and fiber internet providers. Tesla (TSLA) stock rebounds as the company prepares to launch robotaxis in San Francisco, according to Business Insider. However, concerns grow over reports from The Information about the company's slow production of its Optimus humanoid robots. Volkswagen (VWAGY) lowered its full-year guidance after reporting a second quarter profit decline, attributing the drop to over $1.5 billion in US tariff costs from the trade war. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

content.title: Charter Communications, Tesla, Volkswagen: Trending Tickers
content.description:
Charter Communications (CHTR) stock is plummeting after reporting a second quarter earnings miss and greater-than-expected customer losses amid competition from mobile and fiber internet providers.

Tesla (TSLA) stock rebounds as the company prepares to launch robotaxis in San Francisco, according to Business Insider. However, concerns grow over reports from The Information about the company's slow production of its Optimus humanoid robots.

Volkswagen (VWAGY) lowered its full-year guidance after reporting a second quarter profit decline, attributing the drop to over $1.5 billion in US tariff costs from the trade war.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) Posts Q2 Sales In Line With Estimates But Stock Drops
summary: Cable, internet, and telephone services provider Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $13.77 billion. Its GAAP profit of $9.18 per share was 5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) Posts Q2 Sales In Line With Estimates But Stock Drops
content.summary: Cable, internet, and telephone services provider Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $13.77 billion. Its GAAP profit of $9.18 per share was 5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Charter Communications shares tumble after earnings miss
summary: Investing.com -- Charter Communications (NASDAQ:CHTR), Inc. reported second-quarter earnings that fell short of analyst expectations, sending shares down 6.8% as investors reacted to the earnings miss and continued customer losses.

content.title: Charter Communications shares tumble after earnings miss

headline: Charter Announces Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Charter Communications, Inc. (along with its subsidiaries, the "Company" or "Charter"), which operates the Spectrum brand, today reported financial and operating results for the three and six months ended June 30, 2025.
